skill.author: AppleLamps

security_audit.summary: Prompt-based skill with read-only tools only. Uses Read, Grep, and Glob to analyze code for security issues. No executable code, no network access, no filesystem writes, no command execution. Legitimate security auditing tool with appropriate guardrails.

content.value_statement: Manual security reviews are time-consuming and may miss common vulnerabilities. This skill systematically checks code for command injection risks, permission issues, and exposed secrets using read-only analysis tools.
actual_capabilities: Review command execution code for shell injection vulnerabilities
Check tool permission configurations for security gaps
Audit secrets management for hardcoded API keys
Analyze WebSocket endpoints for authentication issues
Review frontend code for XSS and data exposure risks
Generate security reports with critical and warning findings
limitations: Read-only analysis only, cannot modify or fix issues automatically
Requires user approval before implementing any recommended fixes
Analysis scope limited to the codebase being reviewed

output_examples.input: Run a security audit on this codebase
output: - Shell injection risk in backend/main.py:123 (user input concatenated into os.system call)
- WebSocket endpoint /ws lacks authentication in main.py:45
- python-dotenv not used for environment variable loading
- Use parameterized commands instead of string concatenation
- Add authentication middleware to WebSocket endpoints
- Move sensitive variables to environment files

best_practices: Run security audits before merging any code involving command execution or secrets
Address critical findings immediately before deployment
Use parameterized queries and commands to prevent injection attacks
anti_patterns: Running audits on production systems without user approval for fixes
Exploiting discovered vulnerabilities instead of reporting them
Skipping security reviews for "trusted" internal code

faq.question: Which AI tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill is designed specifically for Claude Code. It may work with other Claude-supported tools that provide Read, Grep, and Glob capabilities.

faq.question: What security issues can this skill detect?
faq.answer: The skill checks for shell injection, hardcoded secrets, missing authentication, permission misconfigurations, and XSS vulnerabilities.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This is a read-only analysis tool. It will recommend fixes but will not make any changes without explicit user approval.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe during audit?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only uses read-only tools (Read, Grep, Glob) and never logs, stores, or transmits any discovered secrets or sensitive data.

faq.question: What should I do with the audit findings?
faq.answer: Review critical issues first and fix them before deployment. Address warnings when possible. Implement recommendations as part of your security practices.

faq.question: How is this different from automated security scanners?
faq.answer: This skill provides context-aware analysis using AI reasoning. It can understand code patterns and provide specific remediation guidance tailored to your codebase.
